name: Albert J. Boro Community Center
description: Albert J. Boro Community Center is a place to play pickleball in San Rafael, CA. There are 3 indoor courts. Tape lines have been laid, and portable nets are available. Reservations are not available. A one-time fee is required to play. The facility includes amenities like restrooms, water, and wheelchair accessibility.
open_play_schedule: Tuesdays and Fridays, 10 am - 1 pm, March 3 - May 30, 2023.  (Scheduled subject to change)
fees: Fee required — March 3, 2023 - May 30, 2023 $4 Fee Per Day

name: Bay Club Rolling Hills
description: Bay Club Rolling Hills is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Novato, CA. There are 12 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The facility includes amenities like food, lights, locker rooms, restrooms, water, and trainers or lessons. You can reserve the courts. A membership is required to play.

name: Bay Club Ross Valley
description: Bay Club Ross Valley is a place to play pickleball in Kentfield, CA. There are 6 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. A membership is required to play.

name: Bolinas tennis court
description: Come play pickleball at Bolinas tennis court in Bolinas, CA! There is 1 outdoor hard court. The lines are permanent, but you'll need to bring your own net. The court is free.

name: Boyle Park Tennis Facility
description: Boyle Park Tennis Facility is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Mill Valley, CA. There are 4 outdoor hard courts. The lines are permanent, but you'll need to bring your own net. Players have access to a pro shop or equipment store, restrooms, and water. A membership is required to play.

name: Canon Swim and Tennis Club
description: Canon Swim and Tennis Club is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Fairfax, CA. There are 6 outdoor acrylic courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The facility includes amenities like restrooms, food, water, and lights. A membership is required to play.

name: Corte Madera Town Park
description: Corte Madera Town Park is a place to play pickleball in Corte Madera, CA. There are 2 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The courts are free. Amenities include lights, restrooms, and water.
hours: Monday through Thursday from 8:30AM to 4:00PM (closed on Fridays) Engineering Support & Technical Review of Public Works and Sanitary District No. 2 Permits (sewer, encroachment, floodplain, etc.): Tuesdays and Thursdays between 8:30AM to 3:30PM. name: Flyte Racquet Club
description: We also have dry saunas in men’s and women’s locker rooms, upstairs lounge with shuffleboard, ping-pong table, pool table and conference room.  Our fully equipped gym and treatment rooms are almost complete.

name: Lagunitas Pickleball Club
description: Lagunitas Pickleball Club is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in San Geronimo, CA. There is 1 outdoor hard court. The lines are overlaid on a tennis court, so the net is a little taller than a normal pickleball net. A one-time fee is required to play.

name: Marinship Park
description: Marinship Park is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Sausalito, CA. There are 3 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. A membership is required to play. Amenities include restrooms. The courts can be reserved.

name: Martin Luther King Jr Park
description: Come play pickleball at Martin Luther King Jr Park in Sausalito, CA! There are 4 hard and wood courts. 2 are outdoors and 2 are indoors. name: McInnis Park Pickleball/Tennis Courts
description: No locker rooms on site. Parking lot has high vehicle break ins. Please keep your valuables on you at all times.
fees: Fee required — $13 reserves two pickleball courts (drawn over one tennis court) for one hour

name: McNears Beach Park
description: Two tennis courts one lined with Pickleball lines for two pickleball courts.
